thig5.2:2.2: There are several ways to interpret this line. For example, "uttering intricate and foolish speech"; or taking 'sucittaṁ' to be an adjective referring to her body (ie, the body is intricately/beautifully embellished, and she also utters foolish speech, or speech for fools - 'bālalapanaṁ' can mean "foolish speech", "speech for fools", "speech by fools", etc.
thig5.2:3.4: and I made fun of many people.
